title: Decoding Market Structure Part 2 Bonus
description: Understanding equal highs, inducement, liquidity sweeps, and high-probability setups.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• Equal highs as liquidity repositories
• Inducement trap mechanics
• Valid structural shift requirements
• Liquidity sweeps and expansion
• Confluence with structure and liquidity
• Reducing uncertainty through alignment

quiz.question: Equal highs typically hold:
quiz.explanation: Equal highs are where stop losses and orders cluster, holding liquidity for institutions to grab.

quiz.question: Inducement is used to:
quiz.explanation: Inducement is when price moves falsely to trap traders before the real move begins.

quiz.question: Valid structural shift requires:
quiz.explanation: A valid shift requires a strong closing candle beyond the level, not just a wick touch.

quiz.question: Liquidity sweep often leads to:
quiz.explanation: After grabbing liquidity, price typically expands in the intended direction.

quiz.question: Structure + liquidity confluence reduces:
quiz.explanation: When structure aligns with liquidity, uncertainty decreases and probability increases.
